summary: The concept of "digital infrastructure supply" pertains to the construction and town planning category within EU legal and regulatory frameworks. It encompasses the provision and development of essential digital networks and facilities, which are critical for enabling connectivity and supporting the digital economy. This includes the installation of broadband, data centers, and other technological frameworks necessary for efficient digital communication. The EU recognizes the importance of robust digital infrastructure in fostering innovation, enhancing competitiveness, and ensuring equitable access to digital services across member states. Regulatory measures may address planning permissions, environmental impacts, and public-private partnerships in this domain.
